survey.description:
Esta es la encuesta estándar que contiene todos los atributos necesarios para que funcione una encuesta Collect Earth, además de algunos atributos de demostración que muestran las opciones para el diseño de la encuesta.
Puede generar el diseño de muestreo utilizando la aplicación Grid Generator GEE: https://collectearth.users.earthengine.app/view/collect-earth-grid-generator.
Los archivos CSV con las ubicaciones de las parcelas deben agregarse a la encuesta a través de la sección Archivos adjuntos (tipo de cuadrícula) debajo de este texto. También puede agregar el archivo areas_per_attribute.csv para permitir los cálculos del área del factor de expansión del gráfico. Vea esto: https://openforis.support/questions/1061/assign-area-to-plots
Debe utilizar este texto de descripción para documentar los cambios que realice en la encuesta.
¡Use el botón VISTA PREVIA en la parte inferior de la página para ver el formulario a medida que lo edita!

Este é o levantamento padrão que contém todos os atributos necessários para que um levantamento Collect Earth funcione, além de alguns atributos de demonstração que mostram as opções para o design do levantamento.
Você pode gerar o projeto de amostragem usando o Grid Generator GEE App: https://collectearth.users.earthengine.app/view/collect-earth-grid-generator.
Os arquivos CSV com as localizações das parcelas devem ser adicionados ao levantamento através da seção Arquivos anexados (tipo grade) abaixo deste texto. Você também pode adicionar o arquivo areas_per_attribute.csv para permitir cálculos de área de fator de expansão de plotagem. Veja isto: https://openforis.support/questions/1061/assign-area-to-plots
Você deve usar este texto descritivo para documentar as alterações feitas na pesquisa.
Use o botão VISUALIZAR na parte inferior da página para visualizar o formulário enquanto o edita!

Il s'agit de l'enquête standard qui contient tous les attributs nécessaires au bon fonctionnement d'une enquête Collect Earth, ainsi que des attributs de démonstration présentant les options de conception de l'enquête.
Vous pouvez générer le plan d'échantillonnage à l'aide de l'application Grid Generator GEE : https://collectearth.users.earthengine.app/view/collect-earth-grid-generator.
Les fichiers CSV avec les emplacements des parcelles doivent être ajoutés à l'enquête via la section Fichiers joints (type de grille) sous ce texte. Vous pouvez également ajouter le fichier areas_per_attribute.csv pour permettre les calculs de surface du facteur d'expansion du tracé. Voir ceci : https://openforis.support/questions/1061/assign-area-to-plots
Vous devez utiliser ce texte de description pour documenter les modifications que vous apportez à l'enquête.
Utilisez le bouton PREVIEW en bas de la page pour voir le formulaire au fur et à mesure que vous le modifiez !

"This survey constitutes a standardized methodology within the framework of the European Union's Deforestation Regulation (EUDR). It is designed to facilitate the verification of agricultural commodity production plots.
This is achieved through the utilization of high-resolution satellite imagery, alongside established global datasets pertaining to tree cover and land cover. The primary objective is to ascertain whether the commodities are sourced from plots that are compliant with deforestation-free land use standards.

boolean.description:
Internal attribute used by Collect Earth to track if a plot has been fully assessed and has no validation issues. If the user starts filling the data of a plot without fully answering all the questions this value will be FALSE (0) When the user fills the data on the Google Earth balloon and finally clicks on the send button,, and if the plots attributes validation rules are passes, this value becomes TRUE (1) and the user sees a GREEN TICK on the list of plots on the Google Earth interface.
DO NOT REMOVE!

Atributo interno utilizado por Collect Earth para comprobar si una parcela se ha evaluado completamente y no tiene problemas de validación. Si el usuario empieza a llenar los datos de una parcela sin contestar completamente todas las preguntas este valor será FALSO (0) Cuando el usuario completa los datos en Google Earth y finalmente hace clic en el botón Enviar, y si se pasan las reglas de validación de los atributos de las parcelas, este valor se convierte en VERDADERO (1) y el usuario ve una MARCA VERDE en la lista de parcelas en la interfaz de Google Earth.
¡NO QUITAR!

Attribut interne utilisé par Collect Earth pour savoir si une parcelle a été entièrement évaluée et n'a pas de problèmes de validation. Si l'utilisateur commence à remplir les données d'un tracé sans répondre complètement à toutes les questions, cette valeur sera FALSE (0) Lorsque l'utilisateur renseigne les données sur Google Earth et clique enfin sur le bouton envoyer, et si les règles de validation des attributs des parcelles sont respectées, cette valeur devient TRUE (1) et l'utilisateur voit un COCHE VERT sur la liste des parcelles sur l'interface de Google Earth.
NE PAS ENLEVER!

Atributo interno usado pelo Collect Earth para rastrear se um lote foi totalmente avaliado e não apresenta problemas de validação. Caso o usuário comece a preencher os dados de uma parcela sem responder totalmente a todas as questões este valor será FALSO (0) Quando o usuário preenche os dados no balão do Google Earth e finalmente clica no botão enviar, e se as regras de validação dos atributos das parcelas são aprovadas, esse valor se torna VERDADEIRO (1) e o usuário vê um TICK VERDE na lista de parcelas em a interface do Google Earth.
NÃO REMOVA!

number.description:
The European Space Agency (ESA) WorldCover 10 m 2020 product provides a global land cover map for 2020 at 10 m resolution based on Sentinel-1 and Sentinel-2 data. The WorldCover product comes with 11 land cover classes and has been generated in the framework of the ESA WorldCover project, part of the 5th Earth Observation Envelope Programme (EOEP-5) of the European Space Agency.
The WorldCover product is filter for classes: Mangroves (95) aor Trees (10)

number.name: jaxatrees
number.label: % Forest/No Forest 2020 - JAXA/ALOS/PALSAR/YEARLY/FNF4
number.description: The global forest/non-forest map (FNF) is generated by classifying the SAR image (backscattering coefficient) in the global 25m resolution PALSAR-2/PALSAR SAR mosaic so that strong and low backscatter pixels are assigned as "forest" and "non-forest", respectively. Here, "forest" is defined as the natural forest with the area larger than 0.5 ha and forest cover over 10%. This definition is the same as the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) definition. Since the radar backscatter from the forest depends on the region (climate zone), the classification of Forest/Non-Forest is conducted by using a region-dependent threshold of backscatter. The classification accuracy is checked by using in-situ photos and high-resolution optical satellite images.

number.name: jrcgfc2020
number.label: % TREES 2020 - EC JRC global map of forest cover 2020, V1
number.description: The EC JRC global map of forest cover provides a spatially explicit representation of forest presence and absence for the year 2020 at 10m spatial resolution. Forest means land spanning more than 0.5 hectares with trees higher than 5 meters and a canopy cover of more than 10%, or trees able to reach those thresholds in situ, excluding land that is predominantly under agricultural or urban land use. Agricultural use means the use of land for the purpose of agriculture, including for agricultural plantations (i.e. tree stands in agricultural production systems such as fruit tree plantations, oil palm plantations, olive orchards and agroforestry systems) and set- aside agricultural areas, and for rearing livestock. All plantations of relevant commodities other than wood, that is cattle, cocoa, coffee, oil palm, rubber, soya, are excluded from the forest definition.

number.name: gfctrees2020

number.description: Hansen Global Forest Change v1.10 Tree cover in 2020 (taking into consideration Tree Cover in 2000 and tree loss since 200 to 2020 )

number.name: gladlandcovertrees2020
number.label: % TREES 2020 - GLAD Global Land Cover and Land Use Change, 2000-2020
number.description:
Global Land Cover and Land Use Change, 2000-2020 . Data for 2020 using the Wetland and Terra Firma strata of land cover with trees above 5m.
The GLAD Global Land Cover and Land Use Change dataset quantifies changes in forest extent and height, cropland, built-up lands, surface water, and perennial snow and ice extent from the year 2000 to 2020 at 30-m spatial resolution. The global dataset derived from the GLAD Landsat Analysis Ready Data. Each thematic product was independently derived using state-of-the-art, locally and regionally calibrated machine learning tools.

number.name: phtf2020
number.label: % of plot in Primary Humid Tropical Forests
number.description:
Primary Humid Forests in 2000 that according to the GLobal Forest Change dataset are still forest in 2020 ( no forest loss before 2020)
Primary humid tropical forests provide numerous global ecosystem services, but are under continuing threat of clearing from economic drivers. To facilitate national land use planning and balancing the goals of economic development and maintenance of ecosystem services, a primary humid tropical forest map was created by the UMD GLAD team. The primary forest extent was mapped for the year 2001 at a spatial resolution of 30 meters using globally acquired, free-of-charge, and consistently processed Landsat imagery.

number.name: wcmcwdpaprotection
number.label: % of plot inisde Protected Area WCMC-WDPA
number.description: The World Database on Protected Areas (WDPA) is the most up-to-date and complete source of information on protected areas, updated monthly with submissions from governments, non-governmental organizations, landowners, and communities. It is managed by the United Nations Environment Programme's World Conservation Monitoring Centre (UNEP-WCMC) with support from IUCN and its World Commission on Protected Areas (WCPA).

number.name: raddalerts
number.label: RADD Alerts From 2020 (% of plot affected)
number.description: RADD (Radar for Detecting Deforestation) Alerts are an advanced monitoring system specifically designed to detect and alert authorities about deforestation activities in near-real-time. Utilizing cutting-edge radar satellite technology, RADD can penetrate cloud cover and operate effectively regardless of weather conditions or daylight availability. This makes it particularly useful in tropical regions where cloud cover is frequent and deforestation rates are high. RADD Alerts provide crucial data to governments, environmental organizations, and other stakeholders, enabling rapid response and intervention. This system significantly enhances the ability to combat illegal deforestation, protect biodiversity, and preserve vital ecosystems.

number.name: oilpalm
number.label: % of plot in Pal Oil plantation 2019 BIOPAMA
number.description: The dataset is a 10m global industrial and smallholder oil palm map for 2019. It covers areas where oil palm plantations were detected. The classified images are the output of a convolutional neural network based on Sentinel-1 and Sentinel-2 half-year composites. BIOPAMA_GlobalOilPalm_v1

number.name: fdappalm
number.label: % of plot in Pal Oil plantation 2020 Forest Data Partnership
number.description: Forest Data Partnership 2020 Palm Oil map

number.name: cocoakalischek
number.label: % of plot in Cocoa plantation 2020 ETK
number.description: Cocoa farming maps for Côte d'Ivoire and Ghana at a resolution of 10m. The maps are based on Sentinel-2 images taken between January 2019 and December 2021, which are interpreted with an ensemble of convolutional neural networks (CNN), each trained on a large corpus of geo-referenced ground truth cocoa farms and non-cocoa sites, including more than 100,000 farms. Each model predicts a binary cocoa map and the final map is computed by taking the average, indicating the degree of agreement among the models. Additionally, we compute the best threshold at 0.65 according to a held-out validation set, i.e. all values above 65 % in the probability map are classified as cocoa and all others as non-cocoa areas.

number.name: jrctmfplantations
number.label: % of plot in Forest Plantations 2020 (JRC)
number.description: The European Commission’s Joint Research Centre developed this new dataset on forest cover change in tropical moist forests (TMF) using 41 years of Landsat time series. The wall-to-wall maps at 0.09 ha resolution (30m) depict the TMF extent and the related disturbances (deforestation and degradation), and post-deforestation recovery (or forest regrowth) through two complementary thematic layers: a transition map and an annual change collection over the period 1990-2022. Each disturbance (deforestation or degradation) is characterized by its timing and intensity. Deforestation refers to a change in land cover (from forest to non-forested land) when degradation refers to a temporary disturbance in a forest remaining forested such as selective logging, fires and unusual weather events (hurricanes, droughts, blowdown).
